segment.documentation: BGM, A segment identifying the balance message.
DTM, A segment containing balance opening and closing dates and its preparation date.
RFF, A segment containing the number of the balance linked to the message and its version number.
CUX, A segment providing currencies which are specific to the balance message.

FTX, A segment containing free text information, in coded or clear form, giving additional clarifications solely concerning the summary section. In computer-to-computer exchanges such text information will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A segment group giving information on sender, recipient and intermediary.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify a party.
RFF, A segment to provide references which are specific to the concerned party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A segment group to identify contacts and related communication numbers.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to provide contacts related to the party.
COM, A segment to provide communication numbers of the contact.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to provide accounting, fiscal, social or legal characteristics of the enterprise accounting balance.

segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify a characteristic.
CAV, A segment to provide the value of the characteristic.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A segment group providing the following relevant information for a given period of the balance : account number and its identification, period, quantity, stated value and record number.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment indicating the trial balance line number within the message.
MOA, A segment containing detailed information about debit or credit trend of the amount, the amount itself in local and original currency and the currency code relating to these amounts.
DTM, A segment giving detailed information on the opening and closing dates of account.

RFF, A segment containing a reference number which may be a journal page number (folio) and sequence number within the folio (line) as a single reference number or a serial number assigned at bookkeeping entry level (record number) for a given period.
QTY, A segment specifying the quantity and the measure unit relative to the amount of the accounting trial balance.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A segment group containing detailed information identifying an account.

segment.documentation: CPT, A segment containing detailed information identifying the treated main account number and its subsidiary account numbers.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to provide accounting, fiscal, social or legal characteristics of the account.

segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify a characteristic.
CAV, A segment to provide the value of the characteristic.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A segment group providing information on trial balance amounts and quantities. This group provides totals for verification purposes.

segment.documentation: EQN, A segment specifying the number of balance lines for a given period relative to the balance message.
MOA, A segment adding up the total amounts in local and all foreign currencies in the balance message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A segment group to provide authentication information.

segment.documentation: AUT, A segment to provide authentication results.
DTM, A segment to provide the date of authentication.
